item.description:
This day hike is a section hike on the Appalachian Trail in New Hampshire

This will be a moderate 6-7 mile day hike starting at the Gilmans Corner trailhead on NH-25A, heading west over Mt. Cube (2,911) and ending at Quinttown Rd. This is a continuation of the Mt. Mist AT Section Hike held on May 3rd. Our route will take us over Mt Cube and the Eastman Ledges (2,200), before crossing the north and south branches of Jacobs Brook. After crossing the south branch of Jacobs brook, we’ll do an easy ½ mile bushwack out to our reverse shuttle. There is the potential for your feet to get wet on these stream crossings, so consider bringing a second pair of lightweight trail crossing shoes that provide good ankle stability. Hiking poles are also recommended.

This trip will run rain or shine. Please do not sign up if you’re going to pull out due to rain. Hiking in rain builds character and is a great way to test your rain gear.

This trip will begin on Saturday morning, May 23 at 8:30 AM at the trailhead on NH 25-A in Gilmans Corner (New Hampshire, Zip 03777). Look for the AT Signs (Hikers Crossing) and park along the road. There is space for 4 or 5 cars. We will run a shuttle to the intersection of Quinttown Rd and Mousey Brook Rd and return to Gilmans Corner to start our hike. The trip ends after we reach Quinntown Rd and run the reverse shuttle to Gilmans Corner to pick up our other car(s). Please be prompt.

Directions to Gilmans Corner (New Hampshire Zip 03777) Trailhead on NH-25A:

From Boston: I93N to exit 26. Merge onto NH-3A toward US-3/NH-25/Rumney/Plymouth. After 4.3 miles, at the traffic circle, take the 1st exit onto NH-25/Rumney Route 25 Continue to follow NH-25 for 11.7 miles. Turn left at NH-25A/NH Route 25A Continue to follow NH-25A. Continue for 4.8 miles. Look for AT signs. Park.

Other Points: The AT crosses NH 25A 1.8 miles east of the Mt. Cube House, 4.3 miles west of Wentworth and 20.2 miles west of I93. This crossing is also 10.8 miles east of Orford (NH 10) and 11.2 miles east of Fairlee, VT (I91). Look for AT signs. Park.

There will be a limit of 6 on this trip.

This is moderate hike, but in the best interests of all, I reserve the right to decline RSVPs if I do think you will be a good fit. On the other hand, everyone should realize this is a group hike and we will work together.

Distance: 6-7 miles
Elevation: 2,000 ft
Trails: Appalachian Trail, New Hampshire
________________________________________

Please keep your rsvp's up to date. It is very important that we have a true headcount, and not worry that you're late or lost.

Make sure your hiker profile is complete so we can verify that you are qualified to join us on this Appalachian Trail hike.

See What to wear on a hike and pack water and food.

Your response/signing up for a hike certifies that you have read, understand, and agree with the NEHAAG disclaimer.

Carpooling is always advised and a great way to get to know your fellow members.
item.how_to_find_us: Black Car with lots of bumper stickers.
item.name: AT Section Hiking Series: Mt. Cube in Western New Hampshire
